channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix third-quarter subscribers barely beat estimates as ad-tier members jump 35%
item.description: Netflix's ad-tier memberships jumped 35%. The company is on track to launch the service in Canada in the coming quarter and more broadly in 2025.

item.title: Europe's Gas Prices Boosted by Middle East Risks
item.description: European natural-gas prices edged higher in late morning trade, boosted by heightened geopolitical tensions and a colder weather forecast for November...

item.title: Private Markets Are Reserved for the Rich. Should a Test Let You in?
item.description: There is a debate over whether wealth or smarts determines who can invest in private markets.

item.title: Procter & Gamble earnings beat estimates, but weak demand in China hurts sales
item.description: Procter & Gamble said volume fell in its Greater China market despite the earnings beat.

item.title: GM raises 2024 earnings guidance after easily topping Wall Street's third-quarter expectations
item.description: GM's quarterly report comes just two weeks after an investor day in which the company indicated its earnings strength is expected to continue into nex...

item.title: Dow Futures Fall Ahead of Earnings Flurry
item.description: Stock futures declined as the earnings bonanza continues.

item.title: U.S. Fixed-Income Assets Could Outperform in 2025
item.description: U.S. fixed income could outperform in 2025, as the Federal Reserve cuts rates, the economy weakens and inflation declines according to M&G Investments...

item.title: World’s largest sovereign wealth fund posts $76 billion in quarterly profit as interest rates fall
item.description: Norway's gigantic sovereign wealth fund on Tuesday reported third-quarter profit of 835 billion Norwegian kroner ($76.3 billion).

item.title: Nvidia and Apple supplier TSMC shares pop after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: America Is Primed for a Home-Renovation Resurgence
item.description: Falling interest rates are expected to make it easier to pay for big home-improvement projects.
